titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: On the 4th of March 1847. Thursday— Mrs Fader who from the 20th. of November last had been my Nurse left us to return to Boston—

For daily pay as a Member of the 29th. Congress, from 7th. December 1846. to February 12, 1847, while prevented by sickness on his way to Washington from taking his seat—say 68. days at $8. per day—$544.00/100.
Received payment March 1. 1847. of B. B. French. Clerk H.R.U.S.
23. Tuesday— R. Rush— W. H. Powell. Dr Bailey Editor of the National Era— Miss Agniel dined with us.

24. Wednesday Mr Rogers, to borrow money, which he offered to promise to repay in three or four weeks I declined— Dr Bailey from Cincinnati, editor of the National Era came, by appointment from yesterday— I promised to go with him to the Congress library to-morrow at 11. AM— I received a Note from Major Nourse, to advise me that he could furnish a Washington City Corporation 6 per cent certificate of Stock for 99.—from 1st. of April— I called at his office and told him that I had been so long without hearing from him that I had concluded upon another disposal of the 1000 dollars— I gave at Browns hotel a last sitting to Mr W. H. Powell for the two portraits of me which he has been a full month painting—one a large one for himself—and one a small one for Govr. William H. Seward of New-York— He goes this afternoon for New-York— In coming out from Brown’s hotel I was followed and accoste by Richard Hawes heretofore a member of Congress from Kentucky— I invited him to call on me at my house which he promised if he should stay long enough in the city— In the Pennsylvania Avenue between 13 and 14 Street I found a gold breast pin with hair enchased, and the name of Martha F. Hartley— Obt. July 25th 1846. engraved upon it.

25. March. Thursday— At 11. A.M— Dr Bailey called on me and I rode with him to the capitol— I introduced him to Mr Meehan the librarian of the Congress library—to Mr Wharton, charged with the library of the Supreme Court and to Mr Brown who has charge of the library of the House of Representatives Dr Bailey borrowed from
